intro: Psathura lutescens, commonly known as the yellow psathura, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Psathura lutescens is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
